pkgmetadata.longdescription: Time to Event Analysis via Empirical Likelihood Inference // Computation of t-year survival probabilities and t-year risks with right censored survival data. The Kaplan-Meier estimator is used to provide estimates for data without competing risks and the Aalen-Johansen estimator is used when there are competing risks. Confidence intervals and p-values are obtained using either usual Wald-type inference or empirical likelihood inference, as described in Thomas and Grunkemeier (1975) doi:10.1080/01621459.1975.10480315 and Blanche (2020) doi:10.1007/s10985-018-09458-6. Functions for both one-sample and two-sample inference are provided. Unlike Wald-type inference, empirical likelihood inference always leads to consistent conclusions, in terms of statistical significance, when comparing two risks (or survival probabilities) via either a ratio or a difference.
